article_node.title: Stocks and Bonds Climb as Weak Jobs Bolster Fed Rate Cut Chances
article_node.summary: US equity indices rose on lower Treasury yields and expectations of a Fed rate cut after weaker‑than‑expected JOLTS data, with tech stocks like Alphabet and Apple leading gains. The 10‑year Treasury yield fell to 4.22%, boosting bond prices. Energy stocks lagged as WTI fell 2%, while Fed officials signaled a likely cut at the September meeting, with futures pricing a 25‑bp cut at 95% probability.
